metadata.prompt: A fun, animated sorting game. A conveyor belt has various tools on it. A giant robotic arm sorts them into two bins: one labeled "KEEPERS (Multi-Use)" and one labeled "TOSS (Single-Use)".
A close-up shot showcasing the texture and quality of multi-use materials. A shiny pair of metal shears, a sparkling glass bowl, and a sturdy hard plastic comb are arranged beautifully.
A graphic with three icons: a magnet (for metal), a glass cup (for glass), and a plastic block (for plastic). Text below reads: "Hard, Non-Porous Materials".
A split-screen comparison. On the left, a pair of metal tweezers with a large green checkmark. On the right, a wooden cuticle stick with a large red 'X'.
A satisfying shot of a variety of multi-use tools (combs, clips, guards) being submerged in a disinfectant bath.
A shot of a perfectly organized drawer in a salon, showing clean, disinfected multi-use tools neatly arranged and ready for the next service.
A professional stylist selecting a clean, disinfected tool from their organized station, ready to begin a service on a client.

content.SCENARIO: You've finished a service and your station is full of tools. It's time to play 'Keep or Toss?' Let's focus on the keepers: the multi-use items you'll be cleaning, disinfecting, and using again.
content.COSMETOLOGY_CONNECTION: Identifying your multi-use items correctly is key to both safety and profitability. These are the workhorses of your kit, and knowing how to properly care for them is a fundamental skill for any licensed professional.
content.THE_LAW: The law defines multi-use items as being made of a hard, non-porous material that can be cleaned and disinfected. This includes materials like stainless steel, glass, and hard plastics. If it's not porous, it's potentially a keeper.

metadata.full_script:
("Alright, let's simplify your cleanup routine."),("When you look at your station after a service, your tools fall into two categories: the keepers and the disposables."),("We're going to focus on the keepers."),("Let's do a power-up on identifying your multi-use items.")
("The definition is your best friend here."),("A multi-use item is any tool that is constructed of a hard, non-porous material."),("This means it's durable enough to be cleaned and then fully disinfected, over and over again."),("We're talking about the workhorses of your kit."),("Your stainless-steel shears, your glass dappen dishes, your hard plastic combs and clips."),("These are investments, and the rules are designed to help you care for them properly.")
("Think of a pair of high-quality metal tweezers."),("The surface is non-porous."),("You can wash them with soap and water to remove any visible residue, and then you can fully submerge them in a high-level, EPA-registered disinfectant for the full contact time."),("Because they are properly constructed, they can be made safe for the next client."),("Now compare that to a wooden cuticle stick."),("Can you do the same thing?"),("No."),("The wood is porous, and it can't be reliably disinfected."),("The tweezers are a classic multi-use item; the wooden stick is not.")
("So the rule to remember is simple: if it's hard and non-porous, it's a keeper."),("Your metal, glass, and hard plastic tools are designed to be multi-use."),("Know them, clean them, disinfect them, and they'll be your trusted partners for years to come.")
